result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Landon Wayne Vandevoort

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure
Victim Restitution Ordered

ADDRESS INFO for Landon Wayne Vandevoort
Current: 1908 Wyatt Ave., Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2022)
Prior: W7084 County Road W, Phillips, WI 54555
Proposed Victim Restitution Ordered
DEJ

4:09 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Landon Wayne Vandevoort in court.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court for Landon Wayne Vandevoort.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Parties agree to the terms of the agreement. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct's 1 and 3 the State will move to Dismiss and Read In Ct. 2. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 and 3 therefore Ct 2 is DISMISSED and READ IN. So Ordered. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, court enters a DEJ on Ct. 1 and finds DE guilty on Ct. 2 and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 
Court Imposes:
Ct. 1- DEJ for 2 Years 
Ct. 2- Dismissed and Read In 
Ct. 3- Withheld Sentence - 2 Years Probation
Conditions:
$3,500 Restitution Joint and Several w/ Codefendants 
$243 Court Costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
Defendant must submit an apology to victim(s) in a way and manner to be determined by probation 
20 Days in the Price County Jail with HUBER privileges
Defendant is given 0 days sentence credit
Jail term is to commence within 60 days of 08/10/2022
Probation and/or Jail can be transferred to Portage County with the appropriate approvals


Appeal Rights Given
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:33 AM Defendant Landon Wayne Vandevoort in court.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court for Landon Wayne Vandevoort.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Willett states his client will waive his preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant in regards to the Preliminary hearing. Preliminary Hearing waived. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to the Preliminary hearing. Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court schedules Plea and Sentencing for August 10, 2022 at 4PM
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Ltr to Judge re Adjournmen
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
12 Person Jury Demand
Not Guilty Plea
Notice of Appearance

11:28 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Landon Wayne Vandevoort appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the defendant and gives explainations of today's preoceedings. Defendant states he intends to obtain counsel and would like to waive the time limits for the Preliminary hearing and will have the hearing rescheduled. Court grants the adjournment for today and this matter will be put back on the courts calendar at a future date.
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's current information
Scheduled for 03/30/2022 at 9:00 AM

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): JLS unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or the Price COunty Sheriff's Office after Hours
  No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.
